page.title: 01Quantock South - Great Wood
page.content: This is an area of a forested woodland, chiefly coniferous. In the Quantock Hills, some deciduous species chiefly Oak are present. The hills reach to 100 feet at "Wills Neck". Steep sided valleys cut by streams run off to the North East. Deer graze the area, as do horses turned loose by farmers on the moorland. Stags are hunted by the Quantock Sta Hound Hunt. This is controversial as is the Quarry at Triscombe. the somerset education authority run an Outdoor education Centre at Great Wood. There is also a small private school. the whole area is used for varied recretional purposes, orienteering, as in quantock orienteers, walking, horse-riding, motorbike scrambling, environmental studies and picnicing. The forest commision encourage responsible usage of their area.
